Term.Name: Colour
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is deemed, editorially, to be in colour
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Colour with B and W sequences
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is in colour with some B and W sequences
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Colour with grayscale sequences
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is in colour with some grayscale sequences
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: CMYK
Term.Definition: CMYK refers to the four inks used in some color printing: cyan, magenta, yellow, and key (black).
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Palette
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: YCrCb
Term.Definition: Or Y'CbCr or Y Pb/Cb Pr/Cr. Y/Y′ is the luma component and CB and CR are the blue-difference and red-difference chroma components. Y′ (with prime) is distinguished from Y which is luminance, meaning that light intensity is nonlinearly encoded based on gamma corrected RGB primaries.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: YUV
Term.Definition: Encodes a color image or video taking human perception into account, allowing reduced bandwidth for chrominance components, thereby typically enabling transmission errors or compression artifacts to be more efficiently masked by the human perception than using a "direct" RGB-representation.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: RGB
Term.Definition: The RGB color model is an additive color model in which red, green, and blue light are added together in various ways to reproduce a broad array of colors.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: sRGB: ~2.2 Gamma / Rec.709
Term.Definition: sRGB uses the ITU-R BT.709 primaries, the same as are used in studio monitors and HDTV,[1] and a transfer function (gamma curve) typical of CRTs.
Term.ChangeComment: Legacy Name: sRGB

Term.Name: Adobe: ~2.2 Gamma / Adobe RGB (1998)
Term.Definition: In Adobe RGB, colors are specified as (R,G,B) triplets, where each of the R, G, and B components can have values between 0 and 1.
Term.ChangeComment: Legacy Name: AbodeRGB

Term.Name: Dolby / SMPTE RGB
Term.Definition: A set of RGB colour parameters defined by SMPTE and Dolby
Term.ChangeComment: Legacy Name: SMPTE RGB

Term.Name: Dolby: ST 2084 PQ / P3 D65 / 108 nits

Term.Name: UHDTV RGB
Term.Definition: A set of RGB colour parameters defined ITU-R BT 2020 and BT 2100
Term.ChangeComment: Mapping to IPTC

Term.Name: Scene / clip-referred colour space
Term.Definition: The colour space relates to a recorded video clip or an image.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: ACES
Term.Definition: A color image encoding system created under the auspices of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. ACES allows for a fully encompassing color accurate workflow, with seamless interchange of high quality motion picture images regardless of source.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Other set of RGB colour paramters
Term.Definition: Another set of RGB colour parameters
Term.ChangeComment: Update

Term.Name: Mixed
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is deemed, editorially, to be either a mix of two or more from monochrome, colour, and tinted or not fit any of those categories
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Monochrome
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is deemed, editorially, to be monochrome
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: BW Black and White
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is deemed to be black and white
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: BW with grayscale sequences
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is black and white with some grayscale sequences
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: BW with colour sequences
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is black and white with some colour sequences
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Grayscale
Term.Definition: Also Greyscale. The visual material described by this code is deemed, editorially, to be composed of crayscale tones
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Grayscale with BW sequences
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is composed of grayscale tones with some black and white sequences
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Grayscale with colour sequences
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is composed of grayscale tones with some colour sequences
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Tinted
Term.Definition: The visual material described by this code is deemed, editorially, to be tinted (e.g. sepia tone)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Colorised
Term.Definition: The material has been processed and added colours not originally captured
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project
